intro: Veronica micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered speedwell, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Veronica micrantha thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
